section_structure.description: Two-section format with Non-Negotiable principles first, then Negotiable
section_structure.ordering: By principle number within each section

data_rows.description: Data rows for 28 principles across two sections

Term.description: Exact principle name from DuraCube standards
Term.validation: Must match official principle names exactly

notes.Compliant: Contract meets or exceeds DuraCube standard (including favorable absence of burden terms)
notes.Non-Compliant: Contract falls short of DuraCube standard
notes.No Term: Contract silent on this provision where DuraCube needs protection

Page.validation: MUST include both page AND clause reference

Clause.validation: Must be exact contract language, not summaries
rules: If no term exists, state relevant finding
examples: "Neither party shall be liable for any consequential loss"
"No specific insurance limits or PI requirements"
Replace: 'unlimited' with 'limited to 100% of the Contract Value'
Insert: 'Neither party shall be liable for consequential damages'

Comments.validation: ALWAYS leave blank in generated output
Comments.purpose: Reserved for user annotations during negotiation

output_instructions.description: Output as a markdown table with two sections that can be easily copied to Excel
structure: | No | Term | Status | Page | Clause | Departure | Comments |
| No | Term | Status | Page | Clause | Departure | Comments |
1. Copy the table above into Excel (select all, paste)
2. Apply conditional formatting to Status column (Column C)
3. Apply section header formatting (bold, larger font)
4. Merge cells A1:G1 for the title row
5. Adjust column widths: A=5, B=30, C=15, D=20, E=50, F=50, G=20
6. Enable text wrap for columns E and F

quality_checklist: Output organized into TWO SECTIONS with proper headers
Principles ordered by number WITHIN each section
All 28 principles present across both sections
Row 1 contains merged metadata header with project details
Every data row has exactly 7 columns in markdown table format
All page references include clause/item numbers
Actual contract text in Clause column (not summaries)
Status is one of: Compliant, Non-Compliant, No Term
No Term used only when protective provision missing
Compliant includes favorable absence of burden terms
Excel formatting instructions included at end of output
Markdown table format is clean and copy-paste ready

## Departure Schedule: ABC_Construction_NewOffice_$500000

### SECTION 1 - NON-NEGOTIABLE

| No | Term | Status | Page | Clause | Departure | Comments |
|----|------|--------|------|--------|-----------|----------|
| 3 | Head Contract Provision | No Term | N/A | No head contract provisions found | | |
| 13 | Dispute Resolution | Compliant | Page 52, Clause 50.1 | "Senior executives to negotiate before adjudication" | | |
| 14 | Payment and Cash Neutrality | Compliant | Page 8, Item 8 | "Payment: 14 days End of Month" | | |
| 15 | Security & Parent Company Guarantees | Non-Compliant | Page 2, Item 7(a) | "Two unconditional Bank Guarantees each for 2.5%" | Replace: 'unconditional' with 'dated Bank Guarantees' expiring at PC and 52 weeks after PC | |
| 16 | Release of Security | Non-Compliant | Page 2, Item 7(b) | "Security released upon final completion" | Amend: BG1 (50%) expires at PC BG2 (50%) expires 52 weeks after PC | |
| 19 | Proportionate Liability Act | Compliant | N/A | No exclusion of proportionate liability found | | |
| 24 | Set Off | Non-Compliant | Page 10, Clause 11.3 | "Principal may set off any amounts against payments" | Amend: No set-off without prior written agreement | |
| 25 | Insurances | Compliant | Page 2, Clause 13 | "Public liability $10M no PI requirement" | | |
| 28 | Design Liability | Non-Compliant | Page 4, Item 1.5 | "Design planning setout certification included" | Amend: Design scope limited to shop drawings only | |

### SECTION 2 - NEGOTIABLE

| No | Term | Status | Page | Clause | Departure | Comments |
|----|------|--------|------|--------|-----------|----------|

| 4 | Liquidated Damages | No Term | N/A | No liquidated damages provision found | | |

| 6 | Force Majeure | Compliant | Page 14, Clause 16.2 | "Force majeure entitles Contractor to EOT and demonstrated costs" | | |
| 7 | Variations: Accelerations Omissions | Compliant | Page 18, Clause 20.1 | "All variations require written direction with cost recovery" | | |
| 8 | Time Bars/Notification Period | Compliant | Page 22, Clause 24.3 | "5 business days notification period" | | |
| 9 | Assessment Period | Non-Compliant | Page 23, Clause 25.1 | "Claims assessed within 20 business days" | Amend: Reduce assessment period to 10 business days | |
| 10 | Service for Notices | Compliant | Page 45, Clause 42.1 | "Notices may be served by email" | | |
| 11 | Termination | Compliant | Page 48, Clause 45 | "Termination rights reciprocal for both parties" | | |
| 12 | Termination for Convenience | Non-Compliant | Page 49, Clause 46.2 | "Termination payment excludes overheads" | Amend: Include overheads demobilisation and immediate security release | |

| 20 | Risk & Title Transfer | Compliant | Page 28, Clause 28.1 | "Risk on acceptance title on payment" | | |
| 21 | Unfixed Materials | No Term | N/A | No unfixed materials provision found | Insert: Payment for delivered materials when installation impeded | |
| 22 | Intellectual Property | Compliant | Page 38, Clause 35.2 | "Background IP retained project IP on payment" | | |
| 23 | Urgent Protection | Compliant | Page 40, Clause 37.1 | "Urgent works require authorization with cost recovery" | | |

### Excel Formatting Instructions
1. Copy the table above into Excel (select all, Ctrl+V)
2. Apply conditional formatting to Status column
3. Apply bold formatting to section headers
4. Merge cells A1:G1 for the title row
5. Adjust column widths: A=5, B=30, C=15, D=20, E=50, F=50, G=20
6. Enable text wrap for columns E (Clause) and F (Departure)
7. Add thin borders around all cells
